meanings.definition: A piece of armor covering the body from neck to waist.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a sturdy corselet to protect himself in battle.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the medieval corselet displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the actor comically struggled to put on the heavy corselet, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The corselet of courage shielded her from the harsh words of her critics.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming corselet reflected the sunlight, dazzling all who beheld it.

meanings.definition: A close-fitting undergarment, typically worn by women to shape the torso.
meanings.sent1: She wore a corselet under her dress to give her a slim silhouette.
meanings.sent2: The corselet provided support and comfort throughout the busy day.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the struggles of squeezing into a tight corselet before a date.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her invisible corselet, giving her strength in times of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The corselet hugged her body like a second skin, enhancing her natural curves.

meanings.definition: A protective covering for the thorax of an insect.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the intricate details of the beetle's corselet under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The shiny corselet of the ant glistened in the sunlight as it scurried across the ground.
meanings.sent3: The tiny corselet of the beetle was like a tiny suit of armor, defending it from predators.
meanings.sent4: The beetle's corselet was a shield against the dangers of the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The iridescent corselet of the insect shimmered like a precious gem in the grass.
